org.wiigee.device
Class WiiMotionPlus

java.lang.Object
  org.wiigee.device.WiiMotionPlus
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Extension, DataListener
public class WiiMotionPlus
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataListener, Extension

Defines all logic related with the WiiMotionPlus

Author:
Benjamin Poppinga, upgraded by Santiago Hors Fraile

Field Summary
private  int calibrationcounter
          Represents the number of samples that has been taken to calibrate the WiiMotionPlus.
private  java.util.Vector<double[]> calibrationsequence
          Represents a three position vector in which the psi, theta and psi values are stored.

          Represents the offset value of the angles.

public void initialize()
Not implemented

Specified by:
initialize in interface Extension

parseExtensionData

public void parseExtensionData(byte[] data)
Fires rotation speed events if the WiiMotionPlus has been calibrated, if not, the WiiMotionPlus is calibrated by taking 1000 samples.

Specified by:
parseExtensionData in interface Extension
Parameters:
data - The string of bytes that arrives from the WiiMote via BlueToot containing the WiiMotionPlus state information.

fireRotationSpeedEvent

public void fireRotationSpeedEvent(double[] vector)
If a Wii Motion Plus is attached and activated properly this event could be fired within every change of orientation of the device. The orientation is not used to do gesture recognition, yet. Fires the rotation speed event and calculates the rotation event and calls the function who fires it.

Parameters:
vector - The rotational speed vector, containing: phi - Rotational speed of x axis (pitch) theta - Rotational speed of y axis (roll) psi - Rotational speed of z axis (yaw)

calibrateWiiMotionPlus

private void calibrateWiiMotionPlus()
Sets the psi0, theta0 and phi0 with a calculus using the calibrationsequence field. Fires a CalibrationFinishedEvent when the calibration is finished.

setMote

public void setMote(Wiimote wiimote)
Set the WiiMote field with the wiimote given as parameter.

Specified by:
setMote in interface Extension
Parameters:
wiimote - The new wiimote.

Gets the field wiimote.

Wiimote The WiiMote to whom the WiiMotionPlus is attached.

addRotationFilter

public void addRotationFilter(org.wiigee.filter.Filter filter)
Adds a filter to process the rotation speed data of the wiimote with an attached Wii Motion Plus.

Parameters:
filter - The Filter to be added.

resetRotationFilters

public void resetRotationFilters()
Resets all filters which are applied to the rotation data from the Wii Motion Plus. Also resets _all_ determined orientation angles, which should be extended with a consideration of other external datas - maybe irda events.

fireRotationEvent

public void fireRotationEvent(double pitch,
                              double roll,
                              double yaw)
Fires the current relative orientation of the Wiimote to all RotationListeners.

Parameters:
yaw - Orientation around Z axis.
roll - Orientation around Y axis.
pitch - Orientation around X axis.

fireCalibrationFinishedEvent

public void fireCalibrationFinishedEvent(Wiimote wiimote)
Throws a CalibrationFinishedEvent to all rotation listeners.

Parameters:
wiimote - The wiimote in which the listeners are.

addRotationListener

public void addRotationListener(RotationListener listener)
The added Listener will be notified about detected orientation changes.

Parameters:
listener - The Listener to be added.

getRotationListener

public java.util.Vector<RotationListener> getRotationListener()
